reviewText:
DO NOT PLAY. This is a Heroes of Might and Magic ripoff that is Pay To Win. The best exchange rate for this game is the Mountain of Diamonds costing $100 for 7500 Diamonds. You basically enter a portal with your troops, kill monsters, collect resources and level up. Rinse and repeat. The publisher JED Games just suck.

PROS
1. Similar to Heroes of Might and Magic
That's the best thing I can think of.

CONS
1. List of items that use cash
a. Unit Cards
To buy the ultimate Fire type unit which is called a Hellhound. You need 1518000 gold, 1138 Diamonds and a minimum level 19.

b. Spells
You need to spend Diamonds to buy mana, to buy new spells and to upgrade your spells. The best spell is Lightning costing 1296000 gold, 972 Diamonds and a minimum level 30.

c. Resources
Mana, gold, wood, ore, gems and crystals can all be bought for Diamonds. You can even buy resources like gold at a rate of 1 Diamond to 1000 gold.

2. Charges on cards
To further emphasize the Pay To Win system, if you buy a unit card, it will come with charges. Each time your unit dies, 1 charge will disappear. If all the charges are gone, the unit card disappears. The only ones that are immune to cards are your first 3 starter cards.

3. Premium Pass
30 days of Premium Pass for 500 Diamonds ($10.00)

100% at Battle Start, no mana well required
x2 chance to get a new card
x2 resource from mines and battles
x2 experience points from battles
x2 chance to get a more powerful artefact
x10 action points recovery speed

Levelled up.

Uninstalled.

Rag on me as much as you want for the short "review" but when it really is that quick to see what kind of game it is then theres not much to say."

reviewText: Edit - I have changed my review. After the 24 hour PvP immunity was up and I was playing the PvE part of the game, I saw that you're forced into PvP no matter what so that you cannot even play the PvE part of the game. As soon as someone decides to attack you you're thrown into the game and if they have spent more than you, you will lose, you will not have a chance. So then you lose charges. Ok well that would be fine except when you go back to the PvE part of the game to get more charges, someone attacks you again and you're forced into PvP to the point you eventually lose all your charges and then you're forced to spend real money to recharge them. It's a vicious cycle. You cannot get more charges because people are constantly attacking you. This is a shame because it's a decent game otherwise. This ONE point will cause the game to fail. For this reason alone the game is heavily P2W and is why I must give it a negative review.

reviewText:
After a few hours of playing it, I'd say this game is pretty fun, quite fills a gap in the era of turn-based strategy games. This is almost only about battles, so if you want a game where a dense series of few-minute battles follow each other then you will like it. On the other hand if you want something with complex quests, story and game world then this game is not for you.

Pros:
- it loads & runs quickly even on mediocre hardware
- simple to learn, no complex game world, limited number of unit types
- the battles are fun (if you like Heroes3-style battles)
- I don't feel it to be pay-to-win (with money you can progress faster but no money-only feature, and the game is enjoyable without paying)

Cons:
- 2D retro graphics (not everybody likes it)
- lack of in-game help and documentation, and the UI needs improvements in general
- not much configuration options on the settings pane

To sum up, this game is for you if you like battles in  turn-based strategy games, but you don't want things like city building, overcomplicated game rules or complex game world. This is something you can play for hours, but also when you have only 5 minutes for gaming.

reviewText:
I've played 4 hours and don't see how people can see this is pay 2 win, when I am not out of the beginners stage of the game yet and always have max energy being level 17. I am guessing you would need about 6 hours of gameplay to then see the pay2win motto, but it blows my mind how people are so quick to jump to this when they only play a game for less then an hour.

Is the game fun?
At the moment, yes.

Is it pay to win?
Not sure yet, it seems to be PVP based after level 20.

Do you NEED to pay?
No, you can earn gold and resources by playing the game pretty quickly from what it seems and with these resources you can buy items/upgrades etc.

Graphics are kind of booty but what do you expect from a mobile game. The mechanics are very easy to understand and there is no stress on the brain. I would say you need to play the game til level 15ish to see if you really like it. It opens up a bit more the longer you play.
voteText: 22 of 42 people (52%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Product received for free

Well, actually I play this game on Android device, so Steam character got just few hours on record; just wanted to see what have changed about starting this game. Of course, it is a freemium with all usual attributes and with significant amount of players with quite toxic attitude... although, this is quite a good game. Tactics here is less important comparing to Heroes of Might and Magic 3, as priority is shifted for gathering and upgrading strong army and spells. However if correct set of spells and smart tactic is used, it is possible to win a fight vs stronger opponent, and that makes it good and fun.

I play it in rather casual style for few months, my achievements are quite modest: at the moment I can beat it to be in top 10 for boss raid, my character is somewhere in 4th hundred for pvp in arena. This game requires a lot of grind and at the same time it punishes players for overgrinding, as main goal is to get stronger units not more resources. Also I'd like to say that, in fact, 'pay to win' approach is fruitless here. Of course, you will have some advantage, but in order to use it you will have to play, even more than those who didn't pay. Almost none from top 50 in pvp payed a single cent, they are getting 'diamonds' (game currency) as a prize for participating in boss raid.

So I would recommend to try this game, just remember it is all about pvp and surviving in this pvp.
